definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
"eight" component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 八[ba1]
one of the characters used in kwukyel, an ancient Korean writing system
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to establish/to set up/to be tenable/to hold water
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
to stand/to have a footing/to be established/to base oneself on

sentences.english: Security officials rushed down the main aisle to detain the woman.
sentences.chinese: 安全官员立马冲进主通道，扣留了该名女子。
树民族品牌，立百年基业。

sentences.english: Yang is the muscling principle in nature and Yin is the opposite.
sentences.chinese: 阴和阳是贯通整个世界的两个相对立的力量。

sentences.english: My head was rising up, and my body was following it.
sentences.chinese: 我抬起头，身体也随之立起。

sentences.english: KCGMH was commissioned by the Kaohsiung County Government to administer the Fengshan Hospital of Kaohsiung County.
sentences.chinese: 本院接受高雄县政府委讬经营高雄县立凤山医院。
这所学校保证立见成效。

sentences.english: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance
sentences.chinese: 立他作王家之主，掌管他一切所有的。

sentences.english: Thee grass seeks her crowd in the earth.
sentences.chinese: 每株青草都立在地上寻求拥抱。

sentences.english: Eg. The Korean people set up a monument in memory of Comrade Luo Shengjiao.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜人民立了一个纪念碑纪念罗盛教同志。

sentences.english: That’s according the International Institute for Species Exploration at Arizona State University. [http://species.asu.edu/Top10]
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州立大学物种探索研究所就是这么表示的。

sentences.english: OK, then I immediately pass legislation over a contract.
sentences.chinese: 行的话我马上立一份合同传过来”。

sentences.english: Koji Mabuchi, Iwate Prefectural University, Japan.
sentences.chinese: 幸渊，岩手县立大学，日本。

sentences.english: Li northern Mongolian Plateau, Calophyllum southern mountain exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古高原北疆立，琼崖山地南国展。

sentences.english: The soldier was so brave that he won honour in war.
sentences.chinese: 那位战士很勇敢，立了战功。

sentences.english: By so much is it a better agreement which we have through Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 既是起誓立的，耶稣就作了更美之约的中保。

sentences.english: Digital Image Processing, second edition, by Gonzalez & Woods.
sentences.chinese: 数位影像处理，译者，徐晓佩，高立出版社。

definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
to exist side by side/to exist simultaneously
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
independent/self-reliant/self-sustaining/to stand on one's own feet/to support oneself
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself
to succeed to a title/to inherit
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
